intro: Euploca asperrima, commonly known as the rough euploca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Euploca asperrima is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
